page.title: 19MONITORING POWER SUPPLY,RHUM
page.content: Most power is supplied by a 30 kW. turbine. In addition,a smaller Pelton wheel turbine, which has been in use since 1946, was extensively overhauled and coupled to a 15kW., 3 phase brush_ less alternator.At the same time, a sophisticated monitoring and failsafe control system was installed. This shuts down the hydro_electric systems automatically for a variety of reasons ranging from electrical faults and overloads to a low water reading. As a standby/backup unit, a diesel engine driving a 30kW 3 phase brushless alternator is used. This has automatic start_up facility, so will start and generate electricity automatically, if the hydro systems fail for any reason. This scheme,since commissioning has functioned well;apart from the inevit_ able teething troubles! This cheap, reliable power benefits the community.
